channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: General waste bin overflowing with recycling, 23rd November
item.description:
Two general waste eurobins have recently been provided to help containerise waste but are overflowing with recycling. Please could a separate eurobin be provided for recycling and residents advised not to put recycling in general waste eurobin

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Martaban Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Untaxed vehicles, 23rd November
item.description:
Multiple untaxed or no mot vehicles parked on the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 57,59, Cray Valley Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Nappies left on pavement from overflowing bin, 23rd November
item.description:
These bins are often overflowing, and there are loose nappies on the pavement which have not been re-bagged and containerised. Please could this health hazard be cleared and residents advised to containerise waste to stop bags being ripped open by wildlife

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Listria Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Suitcase of plastic bottles dumped next telecoms box, 23rd November
item.description:
A child's suitcase has been dumped, filled with what looks like medical milkshake plastic bottles in.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Moordown, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp post damaged, 23rd November
item.description:
Top half of lamp post has fallen off and the light and wiring is hanging down and street is left in darkness
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Silver Spring Close, Northumberland Heath, Greater London

item.title: 10 foot long hole in the road, right along the edge of the road, 23rd November
item.description:
Massive hole. Could cause serious damage to any passing car or van. Needs filling.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waldens Road, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Playground in poor repair, 23rd November
item.description:
We visited the Russell park playground today and it is in sad repair. The web climbing frame and blue frame both had broken hazard tape on them, presumably as they are both unsafe, but it wasn’t clear. The zip wire is broken and missing the seat. The “rocky dog” seat next to the round about was partly snapped off and unsafe. There was very unpleasant graffiti on the “who’s on tv” board which thankfully my son didn’t read. I’m not sure how the playground is periodically reviewed, but it needs attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large dangerous bonfire looking flipping, 23rd November
item.description:
It has been here for 2 weeks. It’s a large pile of wooden fly tipping which could easily be set fire to and it would be catastrophic. They have also fly tipped by the metal stairs to go up to Colman House
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Empire Square, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping outside unused garage, 23rd November
item.description:
Another case of flytipping in this space. The garage is poorly cared for. This rubbish has been there for several weeks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Byne Road, Penge, Greater London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holbrook Way, Southborough, Greater London

item.title: Concrete, garden refuse, split black bags, 23rd November
item.description:
As usual, flytipping here including: - Concrete and garden wood waste - Split black bags of general rubbish - Paint tins (trapped underneath the large bin) The area needs to be swept as well as the flytipping collected - lots of the rubbish is stuck below the large refuse bin

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Church Road, Camberwell, Greater London

item.title: Massive piles of dog poo right where we park., 23rd November
item.description:
We constantly have an owner who lets his big dog poo right near our cars on the grass near the footpath. The piles of poo are massive!!! It's disgusting. Can we have signs put up. Can I aim my camera at the area to catch the culprit??? Can this current mess be cleared up?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stuart Mantle Way, Northumberland Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Barriers down again & tarmac not replaced, 23rd November
item.description:
I reported this before & it was reported back as fixed....all that was done was the barriers were picked up...unfortunately they were knocked down the next day....the tarmac surface needs replacing..it is no good putting the barriers back up as they get knocked down the very next day

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castlecombe Road, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Light has been out for weeks, 23rd November
item.description:
The area is very dark and is a safety and security concern, especially now during the long winter nights. Difficult to see pedestrians on the pavement when driving in and out of drive ways. I can see this has already been reported but it’s been out for weeks. Delay is a concern.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cherrydown Road, Albany Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
